educational.title: Educational Report Structure
educational.description: Standard structure for reports on educational facilities, programs, or learning initiatives

sections.heading: Introduction
sections.purpose: State the aim, scope, and methodology
structure: Purpose statement → Methodology → Scope
key_phrases: The aim of this report is to [assess/evaluate] [topic]
This report is based on [feedback/surveys/observations]
The report focuses on [specific aspects]
sections.example_flow: The aim of this report is to assess the school library. This report is based on feedback from 150 students. The report focuses on services, opening hours, and facilities.

sections.heading: Current Situation / General View
structure: General consensus → Positive aspects → Supporting details
key_phrases: It is generally agreed that [observation]
One positive aspect of [topic] is [strength]
By far the best aspect of [topic] is [highlight]
sections.example_flow: It is generally agreed that the library provides a quiet study environment. One positive aspect is the wide range of books available. By far the best aspect is the helpful staff who support students with research.

sections.heading: Problems / Concerns
sections.purpose: Identify specific issues and their causes
structure: Main concern → Supporting details → Cause/Effect
key_phrases: However, one major concern expressed by [group] is [problem]
By far the worst aspect of [topic] is [issue]
This is mainly due to the fact that [cause]
As a result [consequence]
sections.example_flow: However, one major concern expressed by students is the limited seating during exam periods. By far the worst aspect is the early closing time. This is mainly due to the fact that there is insufficient staff. As a result, many students cannot study after school.

sections.heading: Recommendations
structure: Primary recommendation → Supporting recommendation → Expected benefit
key_phrases: One key recommendation would be to [action]
I would strongly recommend [action]
In order to [goal], it would be advisable to [action]
sections.example_flow: One key recommendation would be to extend opening hours until 5:30pm. I would strongly recommend adding more study desks. In order to improve student access, it would be advisable to introduce a booking system.

sections.heading: Conclusion
sections.purpose: Summarize key points and overall assessment
structure: Overall assessment → Future outlook
key_phrases: Taking everything into account, it seems clear that [conclusion]
To sum up, [summary]
In conclusion, [final assessment]
sections.example_flow: Taking everything into account, it seems clear that these improvements would benefit students significantly. To sum up, the library provides good services but requires targeted enhancements.

community.title: Community Report Structure
community.description: Structure for reports on community facilities, services, or local initiatives

sections.heading: Introduction
structure: Purpose → Community context → Methodology
key_phrases: The aim of this report is to assess [community facility]
This report looks at [topic] in the local area
The report is based on feedback from [residents/users]
sections.example_flow: The aim of this report is to assess the local sports centre. This report looks at facilities available to young people in the area. The report is based on feedback from 120 teenage users.

sections.heading: Current Facilities / Services
structure: General description → Positive features → Usage patterns
key_phrases: Overall, most residents felt that [facility] was [assessment]
One strong point is that [positive]
The facility offers [description]
sections.example_flow: Overall, most residents felt that the sports centre provides good value. One strong point is the modern swimming pool. The facility offers a gym, courts, and group fitness classes.

sections.heading: Issues / Problems
structure: Main complaint → Specific examples → Impact on community
key_phrases: However, a common complaint was [problem]
Many residents expressed dissatisfaction with [aspect]
This affects [consequence]
sections.example_flow: However, a common complaint was overcrowding during peak hours. Many residents expressed dissatisfaction with the limited opening hours. This affects teenagers who cannot access facilities after school.

sections.heading: Recommendations
structure: Main recommendation → Supporting action → Community benefit
key_phrases: To improve this, it would be a good idea to [action]
Local authorities should consider [recommendation]
This would benefit [group] by [outcome]
sections.example_flow: To improve this, it would be a good idea to extend evening opening hours. Local authorities should consider introducing student discounts. This would benefit young people by making the facility more accessible.

sections.heading: Conclusion
structure: Summary → Community impact
key_phrases: In conclusion, [facility] is useful overall, but [area] needs improvement
Overall, these changes would make a real difference to residents
sections.example_flow: In conclusion, the sports centre is useful overall, but access needs improvement. Overall, these changes would make a real difference to young residents.

workplace.title: Workplace Report Structure
workplace.description: Structure for reports on workplace conditions, procedures, or organizational matters

sections.heading: Introduction
structure: Purpose → Workplace context → Data collection method
key_phrases: The aim of this report is to assess [workplace issue]
This report examines [topic] and how it affects staff
The report is based on staff feedback and observations
sections.example_flow: The aim of this report is to assess the work experience placement. This report examines the value of the programme for students. The report is based on feedback from participants and supervisors.

sections.heading: Overview / Current Situation
structure: General assessment → Positive aspects → Current practice
key_phrases: Overall, staff felt that [topic] was [assessment]
One thing that worked well was [positive]
The placement provided [benefits]
sections.example_flow: Overall, staff felt that the placement was well-organized. One thing that worked well was the supportive attitude of employees. The placement provided valuable real-world experience.

sections.heading: Issues / Concerns
structure: Main concern → Specific examples → Impact on staff/students
key_phrases: However, a common complaint was [problem]
Staff expressed frustration with [issue]
This affected [consequence]
sections.example_flow: However, a common complaint was the repetitive nature of some tasks. Staff expressed frustration with limited variety after several days. This affected student motivation toward the end.

sections.heading: Recommendations
structure: Primary recommendation → Implementation detail → Expected outcome
key_phrases: To improve [aspect], it would be a good idea to [action]
Management should consider [recommendation]
This would help [group] because [benefit]
sections.example_flow: To improve the programme, it would be a good idea to include more varied tasks. Management should consider providing a weekly rotation schedule. This would help students because they would gain broader experience.

sections.heading: Conclusion
structure: Overall assessment → Future outlook
key_phrases: In conclusion, [topic] works well overall, but [area] needs improvement
To sum up, the programme should continue with [adjustments]
sections.example_flow: In conclusion, the placement works well overall, but task variety needs improvement. To sum up, the programme should continue with these adjustments.

event.title: Event Evaluation Structure
event.description: Structure for evaluating events, conferences, or organized activities

sections.heading: Introduction
structure: Event description → Purpose → Data collection
key_phrases: The aim of this report is to evaluate [event]
This report looks at how successful [event] was
The report is based on feedback from [attendees/participants]
sections.example_flow: The aim of this report is to evaluate the three-day educational trip to Bath. This report looks at how successful the trip was and what could be improved. The report is based on feedback from 32 participating students.

sections.heading: Event Overview / Activities
structure: General assessment → Positive aspects → Activity description
key_phrases: Overall, participants felt the event was [assessment]
The highlight was [best part]
Activities included [description]
sections.example_flow: Overall, participants felt the trip was well-organized. The highlight was the interactive workshop at the Roman Baths. Activities included guided tours, workshops, and evening activities.

sections.heading: Problems / Feedback
sections.purpose: Identify event issues and participant concerns
structure: Main complaint → Specific examples → Impact on experience
key_phrases: However, a common complaint was [problem]
Many participants expressed disappointment with [aspect]
This affected [consequence]
sections.example_flow: However, a common complaint was the long travel time. Many participants expressed disappointment with the tight schedule. This affected concentration during afternoon activities.

sections.heading: Recommendations
structure: Main recommendation → Supporting suggestion → Expected improvement
key_phrases: To improve future events, it would be a good idea to [action]
Organizers should consider [recommendation]
This would improve [outcome]
sections.example_flow: To improve future trips, it would be a good idea to plan an earlier departure. Organizers should consider including more free time. This would improve the overall experience for participants.

sections.heading: Conclusion
structure: Overall assessment → Future recommendation
key_phrases: In conclusion, the event was [assessment] overall, but [area] needs improvement
Taking everything into account, future trips should [recommendation]
sections.example_flow: In conclusion, the trip was enjoyable overall, but planning needs improvement. Taking everything into account, future trips should include better time management.

facility.title: Facility Assessment Structure
facility.description: Structure for reports on physical facilities, equipment, or infrastructure

sections.heading: Introduction
structure: Purpose → Facility description → Assessment method
key_phrases: The aim of this report is to assess [facility]
This report looks at the condition of [facility]
The report is based on [site visit/user feedback]
sections.example_flow: The aim of this report is to assess the school cafeteria. This report looks at the food quality, service, and seating. The report is based on feedback from 180 students.

sections.heading: Current Facilities / Condition
structure: General assessment → Positive features → Current provision
key_phrases: Overall, most users felt that the facility was [assessment]
One strong point is that [positive]
The facility offers [description]
sections.example_flow: Overall, most users felt that the cafeteria provides reasonable value. One strong point is the friendly staff. The facility offers hot meals, sandwiches, and a salad bar daily.

sections.heading: Problems / Deficiencies
sections.purpose: Identify facility issues and maintenance needs
structure: Main complaint → Specific examples → Impact on users
key_phrases: However, a common complaint was [problem]
Many users expressed concern about [aspect]
This affects [consequence]
sections.example_flow: However, a common complaint was the long queues at lunchtime. Many users expressed concern about limited seating. This affects students' ability to eat properly during break time.

sections.heading: Recommendations
structure: Main recommendation → Supporting action → Expected benefit
key_phrases: To improve this, it would be a good idea to [action]
The facility requires [maintenance/upgrade]
This would benefit users because [outcome]
sections.example_flow: To improve this, it would be a good idea to introduce staggered lunch times. The facility requires additional seating capacity. This would benefit users because they could eat more comfortably.

sections.heading: Conclusion
structure: Overall assessment → Implementation priority
key_phrases: In conclusion, the facility works well overall, but [area] needs improvement
Overall, these changes would make the facility better for users
sections.example_flow: In conclusion, the cafeteria works well overall, but capacity needs improvement. Overall, these changes would make lunchtime more enjoyable for students.

universal_patterns.title: Universal Report Writing Patterns
universal_patterns.description: Common patterns across all report types

introduction: Purpose statement (The aim of this report is to...)
body_positive: General consensus (It is generally agreed that...)
Emphasis (By far the best aspect of...)
body_negative: Emphasis (By far the worst aspect of...)
Cause-effect (This is mainly due to the fact that...)
recommendations: Primary suggestion (One key recommendation would be to...)
Purpose-linked (In order to... it would be advisable to...)

typical_report_flow.key_feature: Balance positive and negative observations with specific recommendations
